data.title: Mr Liu's Opinions
data.meta_description: 6 posts published by Larry Liu during March 2020
data.text:
Podcast here: https://soundcloud.com/user-280580802/71-chinese-socialism-in-the-xin-and-song-dynasty When we think of Chinese socialism, the first association is with Mao Zedong and the Chinese Communist Party, which won the Civil War and declared the People’s Republic of China in 1949, which exists to this date. … Continue reading →

Podcast here https://soundcloud.com/user-280580802/70-egypts-political-history-and-covid-19 Egypt is a very populous country that is reeling from the COVID-19 crisis. It has the second-highest infection rate in Africa, following South Africa. On Thursday, it decided to shut cafes, shopping malls, sports clubs and night … Continue reading →

I am, by no means, the leader of the country and I have an aversion to apply force and authority, but in this Coronavirus emergency we need a forceful government response which is adequate to the task. These are my … Continue reading →

Podcast here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3G5H5L_fqs As the coronavirus spreads in the US, we are reminded of the perennial war between human and nature. Nature gave us the space to thrive and grow as a species. Planet earth has just the right amount … Continue reading →

Podcast here https://soundcloud.com/user-280580802/68-climate-change-and-australia Australia has had one of the worst wildfire seasons in its history, burning over 18 million hectars, destroying over 9,000 homes and killing 34. In February 7 a torrential rain storm extinguished many fires. By the beginning … Continue reading →

Podcast here https://soundcloud.com/user-280580802/67-the-implications-of-super-tuesday Since Super Tuesday, Joe Biden has become the frontrunner in the Democratic Primaries converting a substantial delegate deficit with three weak performances in Iowa, New Hampshire and Nevada into a 78 delegate lead against Bernie Sanders who … Continue reading →
